title: Understanding Cervical Screening
subtitle: What it is, why it's done, and what to expect

content.value:
Cervical screening — also called the **smear test** — checks the health of cells in your cervix. It is designed to **prevent cervical cancer** by identifying abnormal changes early, before they become dangerous.

 The test is quick, simple, and one of the most effective ways to protect your cervical health.

content.description: Cervical screening can detect up to 90% of early cell changes.

items.text: Quick, simple, and painless — done right at our clinic

content.text: Who Doesn't Usually Need a Smear Test?

items.title: Under 25
items.description: Cervical changes are common and usually harmless. Early treatment can affect future fertility. See a doctor if you have unusual bleeding or bleeding after sex.

items.title: Over 65
items.description: If you've had 3 normal tests in a row, no further smears are usually needed.

items.text: Book your test mid-cycle (about a week after your period)
Avoid spermicides, lubricants, pessaries or vaginal creams for a few days before
Don't have the test during your period

content.title: Takes just 5 minutes
content.description: The entire procedure is quick and straightforward

steps: A small speculum gently opens the vagina
A soft brush collects cells from your cervix
Your sample is sent to a lab for testing

content.title: We use Dual Testing:
content.description: Checking for high-risk HPV and abnormal cells (for women over 25)

items.title: Normal Result
items.content: Your results came back clear. You will be invited for your next screening in 3–5 years depending on your age.

items.title: Inadequate Sample
items.content: Sometimes the sample isn't clear enough to read. You'll be asked to come back for another test — this is very common and nothing to worry about.

items.title: HPV Positive + Normal Cells
items.content: HPV was found but your cells look normal. You'll be invited back in 12 months to check again.

items.title: HPV Positive + Abnormal Cells
items.content: You may be referred for a colposcopy — a closer look at your cervix. Early treatment is very effective.

content.value: Smear tests are simple steps that protect your future.
**Don't miss your screening — it could save your life.**
Take the first step towards protecting your health and peace of mind.
